div.a: COVID-19 (Coronavirus) School District Updates

Report Cards are Available on Tyler

span.p: Report cards will soon be available in the Tyler Parent Portal. Here is the link to access the portal: https://tylersis.basdk12.org/TSI_Live_360
span.h3: How to Find Your Child's Report Card
span.p: If you are not familiar with the Tyler Parent Portal, we have steps for how to access your child's report card below.

p.a: Click for steps to accessreport cards from a desktop or laptop computer>
Click for steps to accessreport cards from a mobile device or tablet>

World Book Day

span.p: Happy National Library Week and World Book Day! Check out this message from our school librarians that includes resources for finding new books to read online! Click "read more" to see their video!

div.a: Read More about World Book Day
Vote for Student Artwork!

span.p: Zandria Halls artwork titled Mr. Andrews was selected as one of thetop five finalistsfrom the 6-8 grade group in the 2020 ESS Art Contest!

All finalists are now featured on the ESSFacebookandInstagrampages. Each like received from now through Friday, April 24th, will count as one point. The points awarded via social media will be added to the scores from our seven internal judges and the winner from each group will be announced on Friday, May 1st!
Each winner will receive a $500 cash prize, so please vote!

div.a: Read More about Vote for Student Artwork!
BMS Online Book Fair

span.p: The Butler Middle School online book fair begins on April 20, 2020 and will continue through May 3, 2020. All orders will be shipped to homes. There is free shipping on book orders over $25. All orders will benefit the Butler Middle School.
To browse the books and order: www.scholastic.com/bf/butlermiddleschool3

div.a: Read More about BMS Online Book Fair
Tri-Bowl Competition

span.p: In early March, 32 students in grades 3- 12 attended Tri-Bowl,a state level academic competition.Students were invited to participate because they had earned undefeated scores or were members of first place teams in at least one local academic game competition.

This year, students participated in On-sets, Propaganda, Linguishtik, Presidents, and Equations at local competitions throughout the year. The following students earned undefeated scores at the Tri-Bowl competition:

div.a: Read More about Tri-Bowl Competition
Free Yard Signs for Seniors

span.p: Thank you to IDL Worldwide in East Butler forcreating and distributing free yardsigns to the Butler Class of 2020. All parents/guardians of seniors are invited to pick up a free yard sign on Saturday, April 18 between noon at 2 pm at the Senior High School.

ul.li: Traffic will be directed through the banana and into the bus circle between the gym and cafeteria.
Please place a sign in your window with your childs first and last name clearly written on it so we can account for each senior. A volunteer will be stationed at the gym checking these names.
Volunteers will be in the bus circle, armed with gloves and masks, ready to place a sign in your vehicle.

In order to keep traffic moving and to adhere to the social distancing guidelines set in place by the government, please DO NOT get out of your car. Simply pull up and be ready to put a window down or open your hatch/trunk. If this cannot safely be done from inside your vehicle, one of the volunteers will open a door and place the sign inside.

span.p: If you have any questions, please reach out toJoy Stutz (jstutz@idlww.com),Joyce Slomers (joclyn_slomers@butler.k12.pa.us) orMeghan Lucas (meghan_lucas@butler.k12.pa.us).

div.a: Read More about Free Yard Signs for Seniors
Photography Class Contest Winners

span.p: Two studentswon graphicdesign awards for projects offered through the Photography classes at the Intermediate and Senior High Schools.
Carson Boden was awarded the FAB T-Shirt design winner. She had to compete against approximately 140 students at the SHS and IHS who submitted at-shirt design projectto win.
Gabby Boden won a poster contest sponsored by'The Flying Squirrel,' located in Zelienople. This contest was open to SHS students in the Advanced Photography Class.
Congratulations Gabby and Carson Boden!

div.a: Read More about Photography Class Contest Winners
What's So Cool About Manufacturing Contest

span.p: The results of the "What's So Cool About Manufacturing" Contest are in! Two teams of students from Butler participated in the contest, which issponsored by Catalyst Connection.
A team of 7th grade students collaborated with Keystone Ridge Design for their video. A team of 8th grade students collaborated with JSP for their video.

The Butler 8th grade team took home the first place prize for Outstanding Videography.Both Butler teams also took home first and second place for the Viewer's Choice award.The awardceremony was held via YouTube.
Congratulations to the students and thank you to everyone who voted for the Viewer's Choice award!

div.a: Read More about What's So Cool About Manufacturing Contest
An Open Letter to the Staff, Students, Parents and Community of the Butler Area School District

span.p: An Open Letter to the Staff, Students, Parents and Community of the Butler Area School District:

The on-going Covid-19 virus has tested everyones mettle and resiliency. The rapid-fire directives and decisions emanating from governmental agencies has produced an unbelievable amount of challenges for the staff, students and parents of the Butler District. We would like to take this opportunity to acknowledge the sincere respect and deep appreciation we have for our dedicated and unselfish staff in meeting these difficult challenges.

div.a: Read More about An Open Letter to the Staff, Students, Parents and Community of the Butler Area School District
All Special Education Meetings, Events, Activities, Athletics are Canceled or Postponed

span.p: All meetings, events, activities and athletics are canceled as long as our school district is closed. Currently, we are closed through Sunday, March 29.Thank you for your patience.

p.br: All special education meetings, includingIEP meetings,that were scheduled to take place during the closure have been postponed. More information for families of special education students can be found on our COVID-19 website. Click to access>
The School Board meetings that were scheduled for Monday, March 16 and Monday, March 23 have been canceled.

p.strong: PTO and other Parent or Student Meetings
p.br: All PTO meetings that were scheduled to take place during our school closure have been canceled.

span.p: Every parent or student meeting that was scheduled to take place during our school closure will be postponed until a later date.

p.br: All school events and activities are canceled during the school closure. Some events may be rescheduled for a later date. We will share information as it becomes available.
All athletic practices, games and competitions are canceled until further notice.

div.a: Read More about All Special Education Meetings, Events, Activities, Athletics are Canceled or Postponed
Vote for Butler in the "What's So Cool About Manufacturing" Competition

span.p: Two teams of students are participating in the "What's So Cool About Manufacturing" competition this year. The contest is sponsored by Catalyst Connection.
A team of 7th grade students collaborated with Keystone Ridge Design for their video. A team of 8th grade students collaborated with JSP for their video.
Now it's up to the public to vote! The voting begins on March 16 and goes through March 20. Please vote for both of our teams as many times as possible.
